title: Understanding the Conceptual Domain
text: The conceptual domain refers to a person's cognitive abilities. It encompasses various skills and knowledge areas.

title: Components of the Conceptual Domain
text: Consider what skills and knowledge areas are included in the conceptual domain. Think about language, math, and reasoning abilities.

hintAnswer: a person’s abilities in language, reading, writing, math, reasoning, knowledge, and memory
title: Identifying the Correct Answer
text: Which of the following best describes the conceptual domain?
choices: the way a person learns and $$problem-solves$$
a person’s ability to conduct their activities of daily living through communication and independent living
intellectual functioning that falls below an IQ of $$70$$ and starts before age eighteen
a person’s abilities in language, reading, writing, math, reasoning, knowledge, and memory
